title: Ultra-Low Mileage BMW M3 Lime Rock Park Edition Heads to Auction
description: BMW has produced many iconic M3s, but the E92-generation holds a unique place in the brand’s history. It was the only M3 powered by a naturally aspirated V8, and for its final year in 2013, BMW released a special edition known as the Lime Rock Park Edition. Limited to just 200 units for the US ...

descriptionSummary: The E92-generation BMW M3 stands out for being the last of its kind with a naturally aspirated V8 engine. To commemorate its departure from production in 2013, a exclusive Lime Rock Park special edition was created, with only 200 units allocated for the American market.

title: Mercedes’ Cheapest SUV in America Gets a Redesign for 2026
description: For years, the GLA-Class has been the smallest and most affordable way into Mercedes-Benz ownership in America. It has served as the brand’s entry point, appealing to first-time luxury buyers who want the badge without stretching into larger and pricier models. But the current version – first ...

descriptionSummary: The Mercedes-Benz GLA-Class has long been the gateway to luxury ownership for budget-conscious Americans, offering a stylish and affordable introduction to the brand's prestige without requiring a substantial investment in size or price.

description: Mercedes-Benz drops the all-electric GLC EQ, electrifying its best-selling GLC 400 4Matic as the iconic style meets next-level tech.

title: AMG Styling, Geely Badge: Meet the Galaxy Starshine 6 PHEV
description: China’s carmakers have always had a complicated relationship with originality. From the Landwind X7 that looked suspiciously like a Range Rover Evoque, to Zotye’s Macan impersonation, there’s a long list of “homages” that would make a design lawyer twitch. descriptionSummary: Chinese carmakers have struggled with striking a balance between creativity and copying the global automotive giants. While some "inspired" designs still raise eyebrows, many manufacturers are now shifting towards more authentic and original styles.

title: Mazda CX-90 Gets More Expensive for 2026 — Time to Shop 2025 Models?
description: The Mazda CX-90 holds a special place in the brand’s lineup as its biggest SUV, offering three rows of seating and a focus on balancing family practicality with Mazda’s familiar driver-focused engineering. descriptionSummary: The Mazda CX-90 stands out in the brand's lineup as its largest SUV, merging three rows of seating with the signature blend of family-friendly practicality and driving dynamism that Mazda enthusiasts love. Its popularity is on the rise, too.

title: 3 Reasons Why General Motors Is #2 in U.S. Electric Vehicle Sales
description: General Motors (GM) announced this week that its electric vehicle (EV) sales reached a new monthly record in August, with the company selling over 21,000 electric cars from Chevrolet, Cadillac, and GMC. title: Car Brand Loyalty Is Falling Fast: Why More Americans Are Switching Sides
description: If you thought Americans were loyal to their favorite car brands, think again. A new study from S&P Global Mobility reveals that brand loyalty is declining, with only 51.1% of buyers remaining loyal to the same automaker in the first half of 2025. That’s a 1.4-point drop from last year, and ...

descriptionSummary: American car owners are bucking tradition - a recent study by S&P Global Mobility found that brand loyalty has dipped to just over half, with only 51.1% sticking with their original automaker in the first six months of this year.

title: Why This LaFerrari Is More Than Just a Ferrari Hypercar
description: Ferrari’s LaFerrari belongs to the same family of halo cars as the 288 GTO, F40, F50, and Enzo – each representing a technological and cultural landmark for the brand. Its unveiling at Geneva Motor Show in 2013 marked a milestone in Ferrari's journey, merging a V12 engine with cutting-edge hybrid technology.

description: Limited editions of the Subaru and Toyota sports car twins are coming to Japan—and bringing a burst of sunshine with them. title: Nearly 92,000 Jeep Grand Cherokee Hybrids Recalled for Sudden Power Loss Risk
description: Chrysler is recalling 91,787 Jeep Grand Cherokee plug-in hybrid SUVs from model years 2022 through 2026 after a safety issue was discovered that could cause the vehicle to suddenly lose power. This recall comes shortly after Stellantis recalled 219,000 Ram and Dodge models. According to the ...

descriptionSummary: A major recall is underway for nearly 92,000 Jeep Grand Cherokees produced from 2022 to 2026 due to a potentially hazardous issue that can cause sudden loss of power. This latest recall follows on the heels of another massive Stellantis safety notice.

title: You Can Still Buy A Rear-Drive BMW X3
description: In 2024, BMW announced that the new X3 would be all-wheel drive only. The rear-drive SUV was dead, and with it, a lower entry point to X3 ownership. descriptionSummary: BMW has revived its rear-wheel drive X3, a more affordable option for Mexican buyers, with the introduction of the 2026 X3 20i sDrive, bucking a trend established by its all-wheel-drive only lineup in North America.

title: Smart’s Iconic City Car Revival Could Be Its Ford Bronco Moment
description: For years, Smart has been closely associated with Mercedes-Benz as its quirky, urban-minded brand. The company made its mark with the ForTwo, a microcar that became shorthand for efficient city mobility. Over time, however, Smart just made vehicles like everyone else: it shifted away from the niche ...

descriptionSummary: Smart's relationship with Mercedes-Benz has been marked by a distinct urban identity since its inception. Its pioneering ForTwo model embodied innovative city transportation, but as the brand evolved, it increasingly blended in with more conventional offerings.

title: This Is What The New Hyundai Tucson Might Look Like
description: The Hyundai Kona is one of the brand's better designs - and one of its better values. descriptionSummary: The Hyundai Kona has set a high bar for design and value within its class. Its success suggests that future models, such as an updated Tucson, will follow suit with sleek and refined aesthetics. A recent concept gives us a glimpse of what's to come.

title: 1993 Dodge Ram D150 for sale with just 29,000 original miles
description: Pickup trucks have become more comfortable and more capable over the years, but they've also become more complicated. descriptionSummary: Today's pickup trucks offer unparalleled comfort and capability, but this increased sophistication comes at a cost - many have become over-accessorized and deviate from traditional designs. A straightforward, no-frills pickup remains elusive, with few manufacturers still offering a simple, classic take on the genre.

title: The Subaru WRX's Sales Are On The Floor: What Subaru Can Do To Change That
description: Subaru has released it August sales numbers and to put it mildly, Subaru WRX sales are distressingly low. title: The Most Powerful 911 Ever: Meet the New Turbo S

title: ID. CROSS Reveals Volkswagen’s Next Affordable Electric SUV
description: Electric vehicles remain expensive in most markets, leaving many buyers priced out of the transition. descriptionSummary: Volkswagen aims to make electric vehicles more accessible with a range of budget-friendly models, starting with the compact ID. Polo and its high-performance variant, which mark a significant step towards democratizing eco-friendly motoring options.

description: The Volkswagen ID.4 was full of promise when it came to the US market back in 2021. VW brought the nameplate substantial updates back in 2024, and it even managed ...

descriptionSummary: When Volkswagen introduced the ID.4 to the US market in 2021, it showed great potential as a compact electric SUV. However, its sales trajectory has been marked by fluctuations over time, swinging between disappointing results and strong showings. A significant refresh in 2024 helped the vehicle regain momentum.

title: Tesla, Ford, and Chevy EV Customers Buck the Leasing Trend

titleSummary: "Electric Vehicle Buyers Shunning Leases in Favor of Ownership"
descriptionSummary: Contrary to popular sentiment, many people are opting to own rather than lease electric vehicles, according to recent data from Experian's automotive finance report. The trend challenges conventional wisdom on EV purchasing habits.

titleSummary: Mitsubishi Revives Classic Pajero Nameplate with Highly Anticipated New Model Arrival

descriptionSummary: Toyota has revamped its Highlander lineup by eliminating the entry-level trim and making all-wheel drive a default feature, leading to a record-high starting price for the midsize SUV, which may be puzzling given its new pricing dynamics.

title: How to Kill Ford’s Most Durable Workorse V8: An Engine Teardown
description: The 6.2-liter V8 – internally nicknamed the "Boss" engine – powered Ford's toughest workhorses from around 2010 to 2022. titleSummary: "Ripping Apart Ford's Toughest V8: A Disassembly of Industrial Muscle"
descriptionSummary: Ford's rugged work vehicles roared into action thanks to the 6.2-liter V8, affectionately known as the "Boss" engine, from around 2010 to 2022. It started in the F-150 SVT Raptor and later dominated heavy-duty terrain in F-Series Super Duty trucks and E-Series vans.

title: 2025 EV Insurance Hacks: How To Save $900 a Year Without Switching Cars
description: EV insurance 2025 still runs higher than gas, and the gap widened substantially this year. Despite what looks like a big dipper, that’s not a price ...

On average, EV drivers now pay around $4,058 annually, compared to roughly $2,732 for ICE vehicles, according to Insurify's latest report.

title: Should You Buy a 2025 Subaru Forester Wilderness Instead of the Pricier 2026?
description: The Subaru Forester Wilderness is the toughest Forester you can buy, designed for buyers who want an all-weather, almost-all-road family SUV. titleSummary: "Wilderness Over Luxury: Weighing the Value of Subaru's Off-Road Flagship"
descriptionSummary: The Subaru Forester Wilderness is a rugged take on the classic family SUV, engineered for those who need a vehicle capable of tackling any weather condition or rough terrain with confidence. Its beefed-up exterior and advanced suspension make it a formidable off-road companion.

title: Slow Drivers vs Speeders: The Real Risk of Speed Variance
description: “Slow equals safe” makes a great bumper sticker and a lousy driving tip. The viral line that a car running 10 mph under the flow is “six times more likely to crash” comes from old, over-simplified research. Modern work shows two things at once: higher average speeds mean more crashes and nastier ...
titleSummary: "Speeding Up the Problem: How Wide Gaps in Road Speeds Put Us at Risk"
descriptionSummary: A popular phrase about driving speed has been debunked by new research. The notion that going 10 mph under the flow significantly reduces accidents is a myth, while actual data reveals complex relationships between speed, frequency, and severity of crashes.

title: Acura’s Next NSX Could Return as a Hybrid Supercar
description: Acura isn’t giving up on EVs, but it is shifting direction. The brand has built hybrids before, but more recently promised to move past them and go fully electric. title: Drivers Spend Most of Their Salaries on Gas in These US States

descriptionSummary: Honda's iconic Prelude makes a triumphant comeback after a 24-year hiatus, boasting a groundbreaking hybrid powertrain that's set to shake up the sports coupe landscape in both Japan and North America.

title: GM CEO Mary Barra sells off 40% of holdings in the automaker
description: General Motors CEO Mary Barra sold 40% of her holdings in the automaker last month, disposing of 372,024 shares on August 28, according to a filing with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). The sale Barra earned $21.67 million, based on current market prices, and leaves her with ...

descriptionSummary: General Motors CEO Mary Barra made a significant move last month by divesting nearly half of her company holdings, unloading 372,024 shares worth an estimated $21.67 million, as reported in a recent SEC filing.

title: The Factors Causing EV Insurance to Be 49% More Expensive Than Gas Cars
description: A new study has revealed that electric vehicles (EVs) cost about 49% more to insure on average than gas-powered cars. The analysis from Insurify also reports that EV insurance costs have increased by 16% over the last 12 months, and EV drivers pay $4,058 per year for coverage, versus the average ...

title: Porsche and Audi EVs Are Joining Tesla's Supercharging Network
description: In a Tesla earnings call in 2013, CEO Elon Musk expressed his desire to open up the company's Supercharging network of EV fast chargers to other brands, noting that Tesla's intent is not to create a "walled garden" regarding this technology. descriptionSummary: During a 2013 earnings call, Elon Musk signaled his intention to open up Tesla's Supercharger network to rival electric vehicles, emphasizing the company's commitment to sharing its fast-charging technology rather than creating exclusive access for its own customers.

title: Another Toyota Recall: Why the Most Reliable Brand Keeps Making Headlines

descriptionSummary: Toyota and Lexus are issuing a recall for nearly 62,000 US vehicles due to a faulty defroster system that could impair driver visibility and boost crash risk. The issue affects specific models of their electric SUVs, including the bZ4X and RZ series.

title: Tesla CEO Musk Stands to Earn Unprecedented $1 Trillion Under New Pay Package

descriptionSummary: Elon Musk has faced a tumultuous few months, marked by a Delaware court's rejection of his proposed $50 billion compensation deal and a public falling out with former ally President Donald Trump.

title: Trump’s Tariff Deal Gives Japanese Cars Edge Over European Competition
description: President Trump has signed an executive order reducing tariffs on Japanese auto imports from 27.5% down to 15%, implementing the deal negotiated in July. The order takes effect seven days after publication and applies retroactively to August 7. The White House calls it a win for U.S. consumers, but ...

descriptionSummary: President Trump has issued an executive order that slashes import tariffs on Japanese autos from 27.5% to 15%, bringing a July agreement into effect. The change takes hold seven days after publication and extends back to August 7.

The raid directly impacts production of the Ioniq 5 and Ioniq 9 electric vehicles while disrupting critical battery ...

title: The Electric GLC Has Mercedes' Largest Screen To Date

title: BMW CEO Slams EU’s 2035 Combustion Ban as “Big Mistake,” Praises Strong 2025 Sales
description: BMW CEO Oliver Zipse has doubled down on his criticism of the European Union’s plan to outlaw internal combustion engine cars by 2035, calling the move a “big mistake.” Speaking after BMW’s latest earnings report, Zipse argued that the ban focuses narrowly on tailpipe emissions while ignoring ...
titleSummary: "BMW Chief Fires Back at EU's Fossil Fuel Phasing-Out Plan, Citing Surging Sales"
descriptionSummary: BMW's CEO Oliver Zipse has forcefully rejected the EU's proposal to phase out internal combustion engines by 2035, deeming it a misstep in addressing air pollution. He argues the plan overlooks broader environmental considerations and favors short-term gains over long-term sustainability.
